t: Psalm 37
The Heritage of the Righteous and the Calamity of the Wicked
A Psalm of David.
Do*pn not fret because of evildoers, Nor*ld be envious of the workers of iniquity.
For*ld they shall soon be cut down like the grass, And*ld wither as the green herb.
Trust*ln in the Lord,*s and do good; Dwell*ld in the land, and feed on His faithfulness.
Delight*ld yourself also in the Lord,*s And*ld He shall give you the desires of your heart.
Commit*ln your way to the Lord,*s Trust*ld also in Him, And*ld He shall bring it*i to pass.
He*ld shall bring forth your righteousness as the light, And*ld your justice as the noonday.
Rest*ln in the Lord,*s and wait patiently for Him; Do*ld not fret because of him who prospers in his way, Because*ld of the man who brings wicked schemes to pass.
Cease*ld from anger, and forsake wrath; Do*ld not fretâ€” it*i only causes*i harm.
For*ln evildoers shall be cut off; But*ld those who wait on the Lord,*s They*ld shall inherit the earth.
For*ld yet a little while and the wicked shall*i be*i no more;*i Indeed,*ld you will look carefully for his place, But*ld it shall*i be*i no more.*i
But*ld the meek shall inherit the earth, And*ld shall delight themselves in the abundance of peace.
The*ln wicked plots against the just, And*ld gnashes at him with his teeth.
The*ld Lord laughs at him, For*ld He sees that his day is coming.
The*ld wicked have drawn the sword And*ld have bent their bow, To*ld cast down the poor and needy, To*ld slay those who are of upright conduct.
Their*ld sword shall enter their own heart, And*ld their bows shall be broken.
A*ln little that a righteous man has Is*ild better than the riches of many wicked.
For*ld the arms of the wicked shall be broken, But*ld the Lord*s upholds the righteous.
The*ln Lord*s knows the days of the upright, And*ld their inheritance shall be forever.
They*ld shall not be ashamed in the evil time, And*ld in the days of famine they shall be satisfied.
But*ld the wicked shall perish; And*ld the enemies of the Lord,*s Like*ld the splendor of the meadows, shall vanish. Into*ld smoke they shall vanish away.
The*ln wicked borrows and does not repay, But*ld the righteous shows mercy and gives.
For*ld those*i blessed by Him shall inherit the earth, But*ld those*i cursed by Him shall be cut off.
The*ln steps of a good*i man are ordered by the Lord,*s And*ld He delights in his way.
Though*ld he fall, he shall not be utterly cast down; For*ld the Lord*s upholds him*i with*i His hand.
I*ln have been young, and now*i am old; Yet*ld I have not seen the righteous forsaken, Nor*ld his descendants begging bread.
He*ild is*i ever merciful, and lends; And*ld his descendants are*i blessed.
Depart*ln from evil, and do good; And*ld dwell forevermore.
For*ld the Lord*s loves justice, And*ld does not forsake His saints; They*ld are preserved forever, But*ld the descendants of the wicked shall be cut off.
The*ld righteous shall inherit the land, And*ld dwell in it forever.
The*ln mouth of the righteous speaks wisdom, And*ld his tongue talks of justice.
The*ld law of his God is*i in his heart; None*ld of his steps shall slide.
The*ln wicked watches the righteous, And*ld seeks to slay him.
The*ld Lord*s will not leave him in his hand, Nor*ld condemn him when he is judged.
Wait*ln on the Lord,*s And*ld keep His way, And*ld He shall exalt you to inherit the land; When*ld the wicked are cut off, you shall see it.*i
I*ld have seen the wicked in great power, And*ld spreading himself like a native green tree.
Yet*ld he passed away, and behold, he was*i no more;*i Indeed*ld I sought him, but he could not be found.
Mark*ln the blameless man,*i and observe the upright; For*ld the future of that*i man is*i peace.
But*ld the transgressors shall be destroyed together; The*ld future of the wicked shall be cut off.
But*ln the salvation of the righteous is*i from the Lord;*s He*ild is*i their strength in the time of trouble.
And*ld the Lord*s shall help them and deliver them; He*ld shall deliver them from the wicked, And*ld save them, Because*ld they trust in Him.
